results.title: AsiaPay Partners with Tai Wo Management to Launch JOIE digital Payment Solution, Enhancing the Taxi Experience in Hong Kong
results.description: HONG KONG, July 4, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- AsiaPay, a prominent provider of digital payment solutions in the Asia-Pacific region, announced today a partnership with Tai Wo Management to implement an integrated electronic payment system within the JOIE booking platform. The collaboration is designed to offer taxi drivers more flexible and accessible payment options while streamlining ride-booking and payment processes for passengers, supporting the city's broader transition to smart mobility. Helping Fleet Operators Expand Cashless Payment Options As digital payment becomes the norm, passenger expectations for cashless transactions continue to climb. AsiaPay has integrated a secure and efficient payment system into the taxi booking platform, supporting a wide range of popular payment methods including credit cards, UnionPay, AlipayHK, WeChat Pay HK, and Apple Pay, with additional options planned. The solution also enables real-time transaction processing and reconciliation. The update simplifies payment for drivers and appeals to passengers who prefer digital payments, enhancing operational efficiency and driving revenue growth. Improving the Passenger Experience and Encouraging Sustainable Mobility Passengers using JOIE can now book and pay directly through the app, avoiding the inconvenience of cash handling or offline payments. The platform incorporates AsiaPay's fraud prevention technologies and complies with the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS), ensuring secure transactions and building customer trust. Tai Wo Management stated, "This partnership meets the growing expectations among both drivers and passengers for digital services. We plan to further collaborate with AsiaPay to explore additional innovations, including dynamic pricing integration." PayDollar, AsiaPay's secure online payment platform, has earned a strong market reputation over more than 25 years. Renowned for its scalability and robust security, the platform remains a leader in the field. Joseph Chan, CEO of AsiaPay, said, "We are proud to see AsiaPay driving the digital economy forward with innovative, easy-to-use payment solutions that enhance the travel and spending experience. As Southeast Asia's fintech landscape continues to evolve, we are committed to delivering localized, simple, secure, and trusted payment services. With the integration of our system into Tai Wo Management's taxi app, we aim to optimize the journey experience for both drivers and passengers while helping merchants grow revenue and expand market reach." About AsiaPay Established in 2000 in Hong Kong, AsiaPay Limited is a premier provider of digital payment solutions, technologies, and services, delivering advanced, secure, comprehensive, and cost-effective payment systems to banks, businesses, and e-commerce companies worldwide. Its offerings cover a wide range of payment methods, including international credit and debit cards, e-wallets, QR code payments, and prepaid card systems. AsiaPay delivers enterprise-grade payment processing and gateway services to financial institutions and is a certified Internet Payment Service Provider (IPSP). Since 2003, the company has been certified by Visa, Mastercard, American Express, and JCB as a 3-D Secure provider, and has maintained compliance with PCI DSS for eight consecutive years. AsiaPay has earned numerous industry accolades by combining its PayDollar platform—which supports multiple currencies, languages, card types, and channels—with an advanced online fraud detection system and a deep commitment to service excellence. Currently, the company works closely with nearly 100 banks and serves top-tier merchants across the APAC region. To support localized service delivery and expert consulting, AsiaPay has expanded its presence to 17 offices throughout the region, including Hong Kong; Australia (Sydney, Melbourne); Mainland China (Guangzhou, Shanghai); Indonesia (Jakarta, Bali); Malaysia; the Philippines (Manila, Cebu); Singapore; Taiwan; Thailand; Cambodia; Vietnam (Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi); and India. For more information, visit http://www.asiapay.com and http://www.paydollar.com . About JOIE JOIE is a next-generation taxi fleet in Hong Kong operated by Tai Wo Management. Committed to improving passenger service and updating fleet operations through innovative technology, JOIE seeks to raise the professional standing of drivers and introduce a new vision for urban mobility.

results.title: Ethiopia completes controversial Nile dam, escalating dispute with Egypt
creator: © Amanuel Sileshi, AFP
FRANCE 24
results.description: Ethiopia’s Prime Minister said on Thursday the contested Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam on the Nile is complete, a key step in a dispute with Egypt over water rights. Cairo opposes the project, fearing it will cut its vital Nile water supply, calling it an existential threat. Egypt, reliant on the Nile for agriculture and its 105 million people, has long sought a binding deal on water sharing.
